bill_title: include certain actions in liens on property sold for tax deed.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to include certain actions in liens on property sold for tax deed. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 10-25-12 be amended to read as follows: 10-25-12. Any deed issued pursuant to this chapter or chapter 10-26 vests in the grantee an absolute estate in fee simple in the real property. However, the real property is subject to any claim that the state may have in the real property for taxes, liens, or encumbrances. The real property is also subject to any lien for municipal nuisance-abatement actions and past-due installments of special assessments for the financing of municipal improvements levied pursuant to chapter 9-43, including principal and interest on the installments except as provided by § 9-43-60. The holder of the deed or the holder's successor in interest is entitled to immediate exclusive possession of the real estate described in the deed regardless of rights of any person to redeem or question exclusive possession thereafter. 170 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.098 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to include certain actions in liens on property sold for tax deed. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 10-25-12 be amended to read as follows: 10-25-12. Any deed issued pursuant to this chapter or chapter 10-26 vests in the grantee an absolute estate in fee simple in the real property. However, the real property is subject to any claim that the state may have in the real property for taxes, liens, or encumbrances. The real property is also subject to any lien for municipal nuisance-abatement actions on file with the county treasurer and past-due installments of special assessments for the financing of municipal improvements levied pursuant to chapter 9-43, including principal and interest on the installments except as provided by § 9-43-60. The holder of the deed or the holder's successor in interest is entitled to immediate exclusive possession of the real estate described in the deed regardless of rights of any person to redeem or question exclusive possession thereafter. 170 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.098 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
